results.title: Working and playing to health
results.brief_description: Shows the programs of recreational, occupational and industrial therapy for the patients of a mental hospital. Explains why and how these techniques are used to bring patients back to health.

results.title: Working agreement
results.creator_credit: Keith Gow, Elisabeth Knight, Don Murray and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Law”.
Shows how an industrial award comes into being, tracing the progress of a new log of claims by workers as it moves from negotiations between unions and employers thorugh to the Conciliation and Arbitration Commission. Cast includes Henri Szeps, Gordon Piper, Maggie Kirkpatrick. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Working
results.creator_credit: Peter Montagnon, Alasdair Clayre, Patrick Lui and Nigel Houghton
results.brief_description:
Episode number 6 of Series “Heart of the Dragon”.
This program is Part Six of a twelve episode documentary, The Heart of the Dragon. The documentary records what is actually happening in China today and it captures on film the lives of peasants, factory workers, Party officials, artists, scientists, and even millionaires.

results.title: Working
results.creator_credit: Karl McPhee, Malcolm Smith, Australian Institute of Multicultural Affairs and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “The Migrant experience”.
Considers the roles migrants have played in the Australian labour force. Several historical aspects are dealt with through case studies, though the emphasis is on the nature and effect of the postwar migration boom. With work as one of the most significant points of interation between migrants and hosts, this episode examines the experience of both good and bad of the new work force.

results.title: Workers Leaving the Lumière Factory
results.brief_description: The film La Sortie des Usines Lumière à Lyon (Workers Leaving the Lumière Factory in Lyon, 1895) by the Lumière brothers is 45 seconds long and is considered one of the first motion pictures ever made.

constellations_other.name: Technology and work
constellations_other.description: How does the godfather of animation and sprocket technology connect to Jane Fonda workout videos and a Jesus biopic?

results.description: Working men and women leave the Lumière factory, through the main gate. It is often referred to as the first real motion picture ever made, although Louis Le Prince’s 1888 Roundhay Garden Scene pre-dated it by seven years. Three separate versions of this film exist. The first version features a carriage drawn by one horse. In the second, the carriage is drawn by two horses or there is no carriage in the third.
description_for_label: Working men and women leave the Lumière factory, through the main gate. It is often referred to as the first real motion picture ever made, although Louis Le Prince’s 1888 Roundhay Garden Scene pre-dated it by seven years. Three separate versions of this film exist. The first version features a carriage drawn by one horse. In the second, the carriage is drawn by two horses or there is no carriage in the third.

results.title: Workers Leaving the Factory
results.brief_description: In this documentary essay based on the Lumière brothers groundbreaking film, Harun Farocki uses to provide an insight into the changes both in work and film through motion pictures of workers leaving factories across the years.

results.title: Workers' compensation and its effectiveness. "On compo": workers' compensation in Victoria
results.creator_credit: Victoria. Education Dept. Audio-Visual Resources Branch
results.brief_description: Two programs which address the issue of workers’ compensation in Victoria. In the first program Noel Norton chairs a discussion between Ian Spicer, Ken Stone and Mark Esler on the aspects of concern to them. The second program gives an overview of how workers’ compensation works in Victoria, the legislative and administrative processes involved, and its advantages and disadvantages.

results.title: Workcover: a comprehensive video guide
results.creator_credit: Steven King, Dieter Vornhagen, Video Master and Kingwest Productions
results.brief_description: Andrew Ellis, solicitor, discusses the individual’s rights to compensation for work related injuries. Topics include: the role of the solicitor; making a claim for compensation; lump sums for permanent disability; the role of the courts and dispute settlement. This program is intended as a starting point, not as a replacement for expert legal advice.

results.title: Work: a window on Australian society
results.creator_credit: Greg Shepherd, Mervyn Dober, Focus Audio-Visual Services and Appleseed Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Australia at work”.
A four part series examining Australians’ attitudes to work and to changes in the Australian workplace. This first episode introduces some key concepts in any discussion of work: labour, division of labour, industry, and industrial relations. Through interviews with a wide cross-section of people the video examines what is meant by work and the work ethic, and examines how people define themselves through work.
